Html: It would be great if the current logged on user could be added as a column option to the status tab of an update.
Each time you ask to see which user is logged on a computer, WPP launch a WMI query. For a computer group with 100 computers, it can take a while before finish.

Thanks for responding. I like the ability built-in to be able to right click on a device to see the current logged on user. This was more of having to save from right clicking on each device and have the information available in a column. This would be something optional and by default did not have to be selected.

To save on the WMI query time you could first check if the OnLine value is "Yes" run the wmi query, if the OnLine value is No don't attempt to run the query?

This application is powerful and a tremendous addition to WSUS!
